Here's the rephrased text with the noisy data removed:

Co-Director of Science: T. Eren Bilir, Monalisa Chatterjee, Kristie L. Ebi, Yuka Otsuki Estrada, Robert C. Genova, Betelhem Girma, Eric S. Kissel, Andrew N. Levy, Sandy MacCracken, Patricia R. Mastrandrea, and Leslie L. White

32 Avenue of the Americas, New York, NY 10013-2473, USA

Cambridge University Press is part of the University of Cambridge. It furthers the university's mission by disseminating knowledge in the pursuit of education, learning, and research at the highest international levels of excellence. (www.cambridge.org)

Information on this title: www.cambridge.org/9781107641655

Copyright 2014 Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change. This publication is in copyright. Reproduction of any part may be subject to statutory exception and collective licensing agreements, but requires written permission from Cambridge University Press.

First published 2014. Printed in the United States of America.

A catalog record for this publication is available from the British Library.

ISBN 978-1-107-05807-1 (Hardback)
ISBN 978-1-107-64165-5 (Paperback)

Cambridge University Press is not responsible for the persistence or accuracy of URLs for external or third-party Internet websites referred to in this publication.

This book was printed on acid-free stock from SFI-certified mills and distributors, and is FSC chain-of-custody certified.

To cite Part A, use the following reference:
IPCC, 2014: Climate Change 2014: Impacts, Adaptation, and Vulnerability. Part A: Global and Sectoral Aspects. Contribution of Working Group II to the Fifth Assessment Report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (Field, C.B., V.R. Barros, D.J. Dokken, K.J. Mach, M.D. Mastrandrea, T.E. Bilir, M. Chatterjee, K.L. Ebi, Y.O. Estrada, R.C. Genova, B. Girma, E.S. Kissel, A.N. Levy, S. MacCracken, P.R. Mastrandrea, and L.L. White, eds.). Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, United Kingdom and New York, NY, USA, 1132 pp.
